Class CardArrayList

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardArrayList

  • public class CardArrayList
extends java.lang.Object
    ..
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CardArrayList()
      Default Constructor, sets initial capacity of CardArrayList to 10 and size to 0.
      CardArrayList(int capacity)
      Constructor, sets initial capacity of CardArrayList to argument passed and size to 0.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Card card)
      Adds a Card object to the end of the CardArrayList
      void add(int index, Card card)
      Inserts the given Card object at the specified index location, shifting over all Card objects.
      void clear()
      Clear the CardArrayList, setting size to 0 and capacity to 10.
      Card get(int index)
      Returns the Card object found at given index
      int indexOf(Card card)
      Returns the index of the first Card object equal to the Card given
      Card remove()
      Removes and returns the last Card object in the CardArrayList
      Card remove(int index)
      Removes and returns the Card object at the given index, and shifts all other Cards down.
      void shuffle()
      Randomly shuffles the Cards in the CardArrayList.
      int size()
      Returns the current number of CardArrayList elements.
      void sort()
      Sorts the Card objects in descending order.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the CardArrayList prefixed with 0 and postfixed with current size.

      • CardArrayList

        public CardArrayList()
        Default Constructor, sets initial capacity of CardArrayList to 10 and size to 0.

      • CardArrayList

        public CardArrayList(int capacity)
        Constructor, sets initial capacity of CardArrayList to argument passed and size to 0.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The intial size of the CardArrayList
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if capacity < 1
        Precondition:
        Capacity specified must be > 0
        Postcondition:
        Creates a CardArrayList with an initial capacity specified

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the CardArrayList prefixed with 0 and postfixed with current size. Ex: [0: [2/3], [4/10], {{10/10}}, :3]
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

        public Card remove()
        Removes and returns the last Card object in the CardArrayList
        Returns:
        Card object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if size < 1
        Precondition:
        CardArrayList must have atleast one element to remove
        Postcondition:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Card object
        Throws:

        Precondition:

        Postcondition:

        public int indexOf(Card card)
        Returns the index of the first Card object equal to the Card given

        Postcondition:

      • add

        public void add(int index,
                Card card)
        Inserts the given Card object at the specified index location, shifting over all Card objects.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to insert the Card object
        card - The Card object to insert
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0 or index >= size
        Precondition:
        Index given must be within current CardArrayList bounds
        Postcondition:
        Inserts the Card Object at given index

      • remove

        public Card remove(int index)
        Removes and returns the Card object at the given index, and shifts all other Cards down.
        Parameters:
        index - The index at which to remove the Card object
        Returns:
        The Card Object at given index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0 or index >= size
        Precondition:
        Index given must be within current CardArrayList bounds
        Postcondition:
        Returns the Card Object at given index
